result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean M. Pfile

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sean M. Pfile in court with attorney Stanley V Woodard.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Woodard states recommendations.  State is in agreement.  PSI to be ordered.  Atty Woodard pleads NC.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty and orders PSI be completed no later than 7/8/2014.  DE advised of felony firearm warnings, voting rights, appeal rights.  Bond continued.

Ct 1:  NC - PSI ordered
Ct 2:  Dismissed/read-in

14CF78 is dismissed/read-in.

Court states case.  Hoffman and Woodard state appearances.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sean M. Pfile in court with Attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Defendant Sean M. Pfile in custody.    Woodard addresses Court;  provides history/status and requests that bond conditions be modified from $500.00 cash bond to $350.00 cash bond, cites status of Sauk County case 13CF418, continues to address Court with bond modification request to include no cell phone usage. Court addresses Woodard; case resolution.  Woodard responds; PSI to be ordered and negotiations are proceeding.  Court addresses information that has been prepared, and not provided to the DA.  Hoffman responds; has not received any information from Woodard.  Court suggests information be shared.  Woodard continues to argue for reduction of cash bond.   Hoffman responds; argues, objects to bond modification.  Court responds/addresses Hoffman.  Hoffman responds; objects to modification. Woodard responds/argues.  Court rules as follows:  Request to modify bond is denied.

Defendant Sean M. Pfile in court with attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Defendant Sean M. Pfile in custody.  Sue M. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial  br. 1.

Defendant Sean M. Pfile in court with attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Defendant Sean M. Pfile in custody.  Sue M. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.  State prints off information so can proceed to arraignment.

Pre-trial conference on March 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Return date on March 25, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Sean M. Pfile appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Kevin R. Calkins appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant recv'd and waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Atty. Woodard represents Mr. Pfile in underlying case.  State requests $500.00 Cash bond.  Atty. Woodard makes argument.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  Court sets $500.00 CASH bond.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absolutely No contact ARH (5/22/00) including social media devices  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
